Eric Armstrong wrote:

>  Hmm. I never heard back on this subject.
>
> I guess JUnitDoclet is as reasonable as anything for setting up
> an initial testing framework.

Just a note to report minor enlightenment.

I proposed two templates for the FAQ, so you can easily create a
test case and test suite to start from. It's now clear that any kind of
generator is basically unnecessary, unless it is *very* smart indeed.

(One really interesting feature of JUnitDoclet was the way it
generated code for maximum-size integers and the like, to be sure
things worked in the extreme. Since those idioms are pretty hard
to remember, they should be probably be put into the FAQ at
some point.)
